title: I have to write something about old style types
content:
Like Garamond etc. but I can't get excited about this..

Maybe someone has some nice insights to make this more interesting for me?

For instance.. why do you like Garamond..

Or Imprint..?

Yes help me!

xo

Margot
author: MargotHoltman

comments.content:
Old-style serifs are elegant, calligraphic, pretty. As a teenager I fell in love with the italic h of some Garamond font, and I've liked old style fonts ever since.

But if you don't like them, maybe you can write about your dislike or indifference.

This is like saying why do you love someone: if you don’t feel it, it is hard to understand. I just love old-style fonts. Why? Well, I don’t know, but they are elegant and classic, and I like that. And they first appeared in the most beautiful books ever printed (IMO).

Another approach: the letters reflect the age in which they were born. And the old-style fonts were born in the Renaissance age, one of the most important and interesting periods in history: Gutenberg, the discovery of America, Venice (Aldus!), protestantism…

Well I do like them.. but I'm not a very good writer and find it hard to begin...

And whats the biggest difference in the French and Venetian?

Well, Margot, there are some things that you should google by yourself. You can start [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131082844/http:/www.google.com.mx/search?q=venetian+french+style+font+differences&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&client=firefox-a).
